title: Direct Support for Manual Creation of Input files
text:
Most simulation software can be controlled with (a set of) configuration files. These files are typically text files, i.e. they can be edited manually. LLMs can support this process.


Conventional tools are mainly used for syntax checks, i.e. they know very little about the semantics. That works for typical programming languages that have a rather small set of keywords and their use does not strongly depend on the context. This is very different from configuration files, where syntax checks (e.g. in the case of a YAML format) does not add a lot of value.
Support for binary formats would be difficult.
Plain LLM’s are not particularly good at math, i.e. they will be less suited to respect contraints such as “the norm of the four numbers making up a unit quaternion should be 1.0”.

title: Direct Support for Manual Creation of Input files
Automating Simulations
text:
Setting up a simulation for materials science and engineering requires not only to understand the employed simulation technique but also proficient knowledge about the file format used to configure the simulation run. Large Language Models (LLMs) can provide support for that.
As part of the FULL-MAP project, co-researchers to support the simulation setup will be developed. The considered simulation tools are DAMASK and LAMMPS.







ollama

title: Scripted
text:
https://docs.lammps.org/Python_module.html
I’m not sure whether the Python API can replace the writing of an input script.
https://opencode.ai/docs




DAMASK has a Python-based library for pre- and post-processing. It currently supports - Material configuration: General layout - Load case for the grid solver: General layout - Lacks support for - MSC.Marc input deck (combined geometry and load case) - Load case for the mesh solver - Geometry for the mesh solver


The documentation for constitutive models is fragmented: - The physics are documented in scientific publications (some beyond a paywall) - Parameter names are documented in source code (Fortran) - Example files for specific materials are provided (in YAML format)



Example files for materials under different conditions can be provided, but variations are not trivial. An approach that might be more ammendable is the use of texture components.




LAMMPS is configured with a single confiuration file.
